content:
Hello,

Can you share more detail about the issue you're experiencing? Without more detail, there's not much we can do to help.

When posting questions, it's helpful to include information such as your operating system, browser version, specific error messages, and the steps you've taken to try solve the issue. This kind of context allows the community members to provide a more accurate and effective solution.

Looking forward to your update!

content:
I'm not exactly sure what your problem is, and what you're trying to achieve. Also, your screenshot do not really help.

The following is what I do, may be this works for you as well. Below is a (partial) screenshot of my 'Feed Subscriptions' window, which should illustrate the idea.

Prior to subscribing to a news feed, I manually create a new folder underneath 'Blogs & News Feeds' in the folder pane. When subscribing to the feed (e.g. 'BBC News - Home' in the screenshot), for the 'Store Articles in' field I select the previously created folder 'Blogs & News Feeds/BBC News'. The result is a clean distinction between different feeds, and new feed articles always go into the corresponding feed folder. So there is no mix-up of feed articles from different feeds going into the same folder.
creator: christ1

content:
Thanks for that.

How does that subscription config folder structure translate in the UI? Do you actually get container folders under RSS as named there, with the actual feeds broken out underneath, in those folders? (You can reference my screenshots - though admittedly it's confusing because Tb for some reason applied folder icons to both the container folders and to the feeds).

The extension of those questions ultimately is: How do (or would?) folders intended as categories render for you? i.e. Are you able to have the UI break out multiple feeds inside a category folder, such that you can still see the individual feeds in a 'container' folder? (Meaning you can click each individual feed to see the queue filtered to just that feed, and the combined queue when the folder is selected. e.g. A container/category folder "Android" with feeds for Android Authority and Android Police (still showing as individual feeds) within it?

In replicating the subscription config from your screenshot, I am finding the answer to above is NO. e.g. The BBC feed inside a folder in the subscription settings renders as a single "Globe" (this is a "folder"? a "feed"?). Screenshot attached.

You can see the difference in my screenshots where, at least functionally, you have feeds inside of folders in the UI... at least sometimes. Other times not (thus the confusion). Also, the most extreme case from the original question was where a feed was put under one folder in the subscription settings and then actually appears under a different folder in the UI.

This is the incoherence that I'm (so far) finding to be a very negative UX for Tb. I suppose you could reference NetNewsWire for a comparison. Extraordinarily simple - subscribe to feeds and group them in folders however you want.
creator: skdajnfgsdgew

content:
to jump ahead... I am finding (this time) that the feeds within a folder end up a single, grouped feed in the UI.

Somehow, I previously was able to get feeds to break out in the UI under folders (see the screenshots). At this point, couldn't tell you how. Finding Tb to be irritatingly nondeterministic. Tbh, whatever the ultimate answer is here, this UI implementation is thoroughly anti-pattern.
creator: skdajnfgsdgew

content:
How does that subscription config folder structure translate in the UI?

In the folder pane underneath the 'Blogs & News Feeds' account there is one folder per feed, including the feed icon.

Are you able to have the UI break out multiple feeds inside a category folder, such that you can still see the individual feeds in a 'container' folder?

Yes, you'd have to manually create a folder hierarchy in the folder pane first. Example:

RSS (=account) |-- Technology (=container folder) 

     |-- Android Authority      (= feed folder)      |-- Android Police           (= feed folder)


Then subscribe to your feeds. For the 'Store Articles in' field select the previously created folder, e.g. like 'RSS/Technology/Android Authority'.

I am finding (this time) that the feeds within a folder end up a single, grouped feed in the UI.

For container folders you need to manually create a 2-level folder hierarchy as described above. Admittedly, the GUI for feed subscription is far from being intuitive. Also, you may want to start from scratch with your feed subscriptions to remove any remnants from prior (failed) attempts.
creator: christ1

Ik denk dat dit niet mogelijk is; de manier waarop Thunderbird accountmappen weergeeft is gestoeld op het gegeven dat elke account een Postvak IN heeft, en daaraan ondergeschikt zijn er diverse andere mappen. Ze lijken onder Postvak IN te hangen, maar feitelijk zijn het specifieke mappen die losstaan van de ‘ontvangst’map op de server. Thunderbird geeft ze alleen op een iets andere wijze weer door middel van een inspringing.

U kunt wel uw accountnaam wijzigen via uw accountinstellingen, maar ik weet niet of dit aan uw wens voldoet.

content:
Beste dacia8878, Ik heb hieronder een paar (mogelijke) antwoorden op uw vraag onder elkaar gezet die mogelijk zouden kunnen helpen.

Oorzaak van het probleem

De foutmelding "Het certificaat voor [MAIL.DOMEIN] is niet geldig voor die server" geeft aan dat er een probleem is met het SSL/TLS-certificaat van de mailserver. Dit kan verschillende oorzaken hebben: 

   Verlopen certificaat : Het certificaat van de server is verlopen.    Onjuiste domeinnaam : Het certificaat is uitgegeven voor een andere domeinnaam dan degene die je gebruikt om verbinding te maken.    Niet-vertrouwde certificeringsinstantie (CA) : Het certificaat is ondertekend door een CA die niet wordt vertrouwd door Mozilla Thunderbird of jouw systeem.    Zelf-ondertekend certificaat : De server gebruikt een zelf-ondertekend certificaat, wat standaard niet wordt vertrouwd.

In het verleden kon je in Thunderbird een beveiligingsuitzondering toevoegen, maar recentere versies van Thunderbird zijn strenger geworden in hun beveiligingsbeleid. Mogelijk is deze optie verwijderd of verborgen. Oplossingen 1. Controleer de instellingen van de mailserver

Voordat je verdere stappen onderneemt, controleer je of de instellingen van de mailserver correct zijn: 

   Zorg ervoor dat je de juiste servernaam gebruikt (bijvoorbeeld mail.domein.nl).    Controleer of de poorten correct zijn ingesteld:        Voor IMAP: 993 (met SSL/TLS) of 143 (met STARTTLS).        Voor POP3: 995 (met SSL/TLS) of 110 (met STARTTLS).        Voor SMTP: 465 (met SSL/TLS) of 587 (met STARTTLS).

Als je twijfelt over de juiste instellingen, neem dan contact op met je e-mailprovider. 2. Controleer het certificaat

Om te controleren of het certificaat daadwerkelijk een probleem heeft: 

   Open een webbrowser en ga naar de URL van de mailserver (bijvoorbeeld https://mail.domein.nl).     Klik op het slotje naast de URL in de adresbalk om informatie over het certificaat te bekijken.    Controleer of:        Het certificaat niet verlopen is.        De domeinnaam overeenkomt met de servernaam die je in Thunderbird gebruikt.        Het certificaat is uitgegeven door een vertrouwde CA.

Als het certificaat een probleem heeft, neem dan contact op met de beheerder van de mailserver. 3. Werk Thunderbird bij

Zorg ervoor dat je de nieuwste versie van Thunderbird gebruikt. Oudere versies kunnen problemen hebben met moderne certificaten of beveiligingsprotocollen. 4. Voeg een beveiligingsuitzondering toe

In recente versies van Thunderbird is het mogelijk om handmatig een beveiligingsuitzondering toe te voegen. Volg deze stappen: 

   Ga naar Extra  > Instellingen  > Privacy & Beveiliging .    Scroll naar beneden naar de sectie Certificaten  en klik op Certificaten beheren .    Ga naar het tabblad Servers  en klik op Uitzonderingen toevoegen .    Voer de servernaam in (bijvoorbeeld mail.domein.nl) en klik op Ophalen van certificaat .    Bevestig dat je het certificaat wilt accepteren, ook al is het niet vertrouwd.

5. Schakel TLS/SSL tijdelijk uit (niet aanbevolen)

Als bovenstaande stappen niet werken, kun je TLS/SSL tijdelijk uitschakelen om te zien of dit het probleem oplost. Dit is echter niet veilig , omdat je wachtwoord en gegevens dan onversleuteld worden verzonden. Gebruik deze methode alleen als laatste redmiddel: 

   Ga naar Extra  > Accountinstellingen .    Selecteer je e-mailaccount en ga naar Serverinstellingen .    Wijzig de instelling Verbinding beveiligen met  naar Geen .    Herhaal dit voor de uitgaande server (SMTP) onder Uitgaande server (SMTP) .

6. Neem contact op met je e-mailprovider

Als geen van de bovenstaande oplossingen werkt, neem dan contact op met je e-mailprovider. Het is mogelijk dat er een probleem is met hun serverconfiguratie of certificaat. Conclusie

De meest waarschijnlijke oorzaak van het probleem is een ongeldig of niet-vertrouwd certificaat. Probeer eerst de instellingen te controleren en een beveiligingsuitzondering toe te voegen. Als dit niet werkt, neem dan contact op met je e-mailprovider om het probleem verder te onderzoeken.

Eindantwoord: Probeer eerst een beveiligingsuitzondering toe te voegen via Extra > Instellingen > Privacy & Beveiliging > Certificaten beheren > Uitzonderingen toevoegen . Als dit niet werkt, controleer dan de serverinstellingen en neem contact op met je e-mailprovider.

Ik hoop u zo goed genoeg te hebben voorzien met antwoorden op uw vraag en hoop dat uw probleem snel is opgelost. Voor verder vragen kunt u altijd hieronder regageren. Met vriendelijke groet AT.

content: Thunderbird is an email client, not an email address. To use Thunderbird, first secure an email account (such as gmail, outlook or others) and then use Thunderbird to administer the account. When you first start Thunderbird, it will walk you through the setup. If you then want to establish an additional account, click the hamburger icon in upper left and select 'new account.'

content: Found the answer to my question ... (1) find an email that you want to filter. (2) right click on the "From" field .. this brings up a drop down menu (3) select "Create Filter From" (4) This brings up a Filter Rules Dialogue just fill in the details you need.

Timeouts are often caused by antivirus. What is your AV app? Disable scanning of outgoing mail, e.g. Avast/Avira Mail Shield.

Also, the security should be STARTTLS on 587, not SSL/TLS.

content:
In your Microsoft account - logged on via browser.... How many email addresses have you got registered in the account ? Obviously, you have an @outlook.com email address, but are there any others ?

Microsoft now deem any email addresses whether hotmail or outlook etc or gmail set up to synch or other domain name email addresses - they are called 'aliases' email addresses to the Microsoft account.

They are all supposed to use the same password as the Microsoft Account Password. You can choose to set one account as the 'primary' account. Whatever you set up as 'primary' is now the email address used to 'send' email via a third party client using smtp. If you typically use a outlook.com email address is that outlook.com email address set up as the 'primary' alias or is another 3rd party email address set up as 'primary'?
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Also whilst in Microsoft account / outlook.com email Top right where you click to see account and options to sign out - you might see that weird email address.

please check to see if any rules have been created to forward any emails.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hi @Toad-Hall,

Thank you for your help. I've checked and I have no aliases with my outlook email address. It is my primary and only email address with my Microsoft account.

I also do not see the weird email address in my Microsoft account or on outlook.com, and there are no rules created to forward emails.

Thank you again for your help.
creator: floen

content:
I found this image which explains where the user found that weird name for their Outlook account.

The same issue as you was reported on Microsoft forum - actually there's a few of these cases reported. https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/outlook_com/forum/all/improperly-displayed-my-e-mail-address-in/ee8fedd2-b0f6-4d5e-bc27-34491006af09 A user in that above link posted an image showing where they saw the data - You can use that link but I've posted the image below.

Also this link: https://answers.microsoft.com/fr-fr/outlook_com/forum/all/default-sct-msonline-outlook-templatetenant-%c3%a0/8673ba2e-78a2-4972-9b6b-d0522f6cfedb?page=5


This error you see is not something caused by Thunderbird.

EXCHANGE+20ADMINISTRATIVE+20GROUP - this sounds like it's got something to do with an exchange account and using a template.

Are you using a VPN on computer ? Many Anti-Virus now offer VPNs and in some cases they have been auto enabling them causing a lot of various problems for anyone using third party email clients as servers do not like your IP being hidden or looking like it's in another country. They think you might be a hacker. Please check you do not have a VPN operating. If you do then switch it off.

What server settings are you using in Thunderbird ? Post a image showing Account Settings > Server Settings and also the Outgoing Server Settings.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: No easy answer. Needs some detective work. The easy approach is to see if both phone and PC are using IMAP. If either is not, that's the problem. If you still don't know, try this: - turn phone off - send message from online account to yourself - check thunderbird for the message. If you didn't receive it, then there may be a need to adjust your settings and you have have received error message. Post that error message and a screenshot of your incoming server settings - if you DID receive it, turn phone on and see if it receives it. If it does, check back to see if it's still in Thunderbird. If not, the phone may be set for POP, causing periodic loss of messages, depending on whether phone or PC is first to see message. - let us know.
creator: davidsk

content: I have had the same problem yesterday. My boss has replied to one of my email. I could see it on my smarthone Gmail app and i can read it on gmail on my computer. For an unknown reason, It has never been downloaded in thunderbird. I use thunderbid for many years, before smartphone did exist. If there was no gmail app on my smartphone, I would never now about this important mail. Server POP mail server
creator: brunoleger

content: I suggest you do what I suggested to the other person; do some detective work. For example, turn phone off and shut thunderbird down. from online account, send two messages to yourself. Then, turn phone on and check for the messages. Then, start thunderbird and see if you receive the messages. If you do not, that is an indication that the phone is POP. I will also comment that, by having PC set for POP, you can never use phone and PC independently as mail receive on PC may not be visible on phone. My suggestion, if you use both phone and PC for email, is to set both to IMAP.

content:
• If you suspect your Google account has been compromised change your Google account password.
  • Turn on 2-step authentication if not yet done.
  • You can check recent account activity and connections to 3rd-party apps like Thunderbird via https://myaccount.google.com/security
  • Do not use Google app passwords.

Also see https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/6294825

content: You need to share the details here. As I understand it, you have a backup and it didn't install? Or is it that the new look of Thunderbird is confusing?
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello there

If Thunderbird crashes it can be several options to choose of what that problem can be or what can disturb the working functions at that moment. Try to start up in the safe modes from Thunderbird. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird. Try to disable these annoying add ons or extensions that could be there. Or choose one of the solving action s to get rid of these annoying moments. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-use-attachments Try to update add ons might be a good way to start. Change the settings of the hardware acceleration. Temporary turn of that antivirus program and try to send some test mail with attachment s to others. If disabling the antivirus works then you could add Thunderbird to the antivirus exception list. You could check if that mail with photo or text attachment is oké to send now and use these steps that are mentioned above in the list. If nothing work try to create a new profile. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles Using the latest version of Thunderbird is a pre must. Please download our Thunderbird software from our trusted download points.


Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

creator: christ1

content:
Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

BE SURE to download from thunderbird.net
creator: davidsk

content:
Are you using a signature file?

Does that also happen in Troubleshoot mode (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/safe-mode-thunderbird)?
creator: siffemoz

content:
Message blocked due to spam content in the message.

The error message is from your email provider's server. So you may want to talk to them about why they block your message. Contributing factors can be

  • Bulleted list item sending in HTML format instead of plain text
  • Bulleted list item a fancy signature containing an image
  • Bulleted list item sending attachments, where certain file types may be considered suspicious by your email provider
creator: christ1

content:
Try this:

Open the current profile folder:

- TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

- under the Application Basics section next to Profile Folder, click 'Open Folder'

Close TB and delete the key4.db file > restart TB

content: There is no charge to use Thunderbird. It is free. But donations are accepted to help fund continued maintenance and improvements.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Font::

- at the top, set 'Fonts for:' to Other Writing Systems if it isn't already

- change Proportional and Monospace fonts/sizes

- set Minimum font size to None

- set TB menu > Settings > Composition > HTML Style to Variable Width and Medium font

Color:

- TB menu > Composition > HTML Style > Use reader's default colors
